Case reference: 2012020143.CaseDesc: Lucie Bouchard was last seen on October 23, 1996, driving her 1994 purple Honda Civic. Around 9:45 p.m., she dropped her sister off at the corner of Saint-Michel boulevard and Cremazie East. She was then supposed to head home to Brossard, on the south shore of Montreal, but never made it. She suffers from epilepsy and requires medication. She may have, on average, 2 to 3 epileptic seizures per month.

Case reference: 2016065869.CaseDesc: On April 11, 1976, the decomposed remains of a male individual were recovered from the water in Port Arthur Marina in the Thunder Bay Harbour. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 170-180 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His pockets contained a red handkerchief, pipe for smoking, book of matches and a broken pencil. It is believed that he had been in the water since the fall of 1975.

Hair: Brown, receding hairline and a moustache
Ring: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Brass ring with a silver finish on the small finger of his left hand
Scar: Right Abdomen, Long wide scar on his upper abdominal region

Case reference: 2012020053.CaseDesc: Jennifer Catcheway has been missing since Thursday June 19, 2008. Ms. Catcheway was seen at approximately 12:00 pm leaving Grand Rapids en route to Portage la Prairie, Manitoba.  During her travels it is believed that she was dropped off near the Waterhen junction - Provincial Road 328 and PTH #6. Ms. Catcheway has never been seen since.

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2012020077.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1986, Alexander Wiwchar, 72 years old, was last seen at 2:00 p.m. in Yorkton, SK. Mr. Wiwchar, who lived on a farm near Canora, SK, was seen at the Yorkton Bus Depot. Mr. Wiwchar is believed to have had some medical concerns and was suspected of having Alzheimer’s disease. His destination was unknown and he has not been seen or located since.

Mark: Chest, 9th rib fractured on the right side

Case reference: 2019071422.CaseDesc: On December 7, 2019, Kidist Mohamed was seen for the last time near Brant Street and King Street West in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006009199.CaseDesc: On July 09, 2003, Michael Linklater, his father and brother went to the Linklater family hunting & fishing camp; located near mile marker 115 on ONR Railroad line, between Cochrane and Moosonee. Mr. Linklater left the camp at about 6:00 a.m. on July 13, 2003, and has not been seen since. His father and brother searched for hours before going to mile marker 126 and calling the police. An extensive search in the area has failed to locate Mr. Linklater.

Case reference: 2006004599.CaseDesc: Igor Tikhomirov jumped or fell off an oil tanker into Lake Ontario en route from Holland to Sarnia on May 12, 1996.  His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2014005517.CaseDesc:
At the time of her disappearance, Amber Guiboche was living in the north end of Winnipeg with her boyfriend and his family. Amber had been leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Amber spent the evening of November 10th, 2010 socializing with friends, later that evening she went to a friend’s residence on Bushnell St. She left there alone at around 11:45 p.m., and walked to the intersection of Isabel Street and William Ave.  

She was picked up there shortly after by a man driving a burgundy pickup truck. The truck was described as an older, burgundy Chevrolet Silverado, extended cab, short box with a “4x4” decal toward the rear of the box. 

The truck was last seen traveling southbound on Isabel St. It was captured on video in the area in which she was last seen.

Images of this truck and a forensic artist’s sketch of the driver have been made available.

Case reference: 2017045266.CaseDesc: On August 7, 2017, James Candy was reported missing from his residence north of Lavoy, Alberta. James was last seen in his bedroom the night before on August 6, 2017, around 11:00 pm.

Case reference: 2018071052.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1998, the remains of a male individual were discovered on Sulphur Mountain in Banff National Park. There is dental work present, including multiple fillings. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 6 months and 5 years.

Case reference: 2014005508.CaseDesc: In October 2010, Maxime Jacques left Winnipeg, Manitoba by bus to visit family in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. On October 30, 2010, Mr. Jacques never arrived at his destination and his family reported him as missing.

Case reference: 2014001134.CaseDesc: Skeletal remains were discovered on the east side of Haida Gwaii on November 15, 1984. A subsequent autopsy showed that the remains were that of a male, approximately 21 to 50 years of age at time of death. Believed to be right handed and dentally conscious having received good treatment. Found with the remains was a tobacco pipe as well as a 2.5 inch tall oriental figurine. The deceased was also in possession of a Gruen Wristwatch.

Jacket: Nylon, Grey, "Jones Tent And Awning" Parka liner
Backpack: Cloth, Dark Blue, Grey, Eddie Bauer

Case reference: 2012002099.CaseDesc: Kelly Coleman was last seen near Mac's Convenience on Mapleview Drive in Barrie, Ontario in August 2011.  Kelly suffers from health-related issues and has not had contact with her family or friends since January 3, 2012. They are concerned for her well-being and are requesting assistance from anyone who may have had any contact with her.

Case reference: 2020001488.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1988, Edward Parsons was seen for the last time as he was dragged from his apartment by a street gang in Toronto, Ontario. Edward was taken to a beach where he was violently assaulted, and buried in a shallow grave. The police were informed of this incident, and attended the grave. Upon their arrival, the alleged burial site was found empty.

Case reference: 2019030954.CaseDesc: On May 30, 2019, Tara Sculptor was seen for the last time by her mother on Carling Avenue in Ottawa, Ontario. It is possible that Tara took a bus from Ottawa to North Bay, Ontario.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, A bald spot on the back of the head
Scar: Forehead, Severe burns to the face
Right Leg, Skin graft removed from rear
Left Leg, Skin graft removed from rear
Back Of Head, Skin graft removed from behind

Case reference: 2014002023.CaseDesc: Lara Brown was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in September 1998.  Lara was last heard from by a friend at the end of August 1998.

Case reference: 2006005399.CaseDesc: In October 1956, Charles Ombash and his brother Tom Ombash left the Pelican Falls Residential School. They had planned to canoe back to Cat Lake, or alternately take the train to Savant Lake, get a ride to Pickle Lake, and then canoe to Cat Lake. Their family has not seen them since.

Case reference: 2013000069.CaseDesc: Richard Riquier was last seen in Montreal on April 17, 1973. He might be in a religious cult in the United States or in India.

Case reference: 2015020614.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2015, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Markmiller Kwesiga was seen for the last time near Finch Avenue and Keele Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Hat: Grey, Toque, Toque with white lettering on the front
Shoes: Brown, Light brown with black sole

Case reference: 2015011630.CaseDesc: On June 9, 2000, a man's body was recovered from the St. Lawrence River near Boucherville Islands by the nautical patrol team.

Boots: Leather, Brown, "Georgia Giant" brand, steel toe boots

Case reference: 2010000299.CaseDesc: On September 3, 2009, Douglas Chong, 62 years of age, called his sister and advised he had attended the Toronto Western Hospital as he had not been feeling well. He advised he had been dehydrated and was sent to Seaton House to recover where he had been for three days and was feeling better. This was the last time anyone has heard from Douglas Chong. He has not retuned to his last known address. Neither Toronto Western Hospital nor Seaton House have any record of Mr. Chong having been there on or about the 3rd of September, 2009. There has been no use of his health or bank cards since September 3, 2009.

Case reference: 2014003548.CaseDesc: On October 4, 1996, Billy Taylor was dropped off at a treatment facility in St. Norbert. Billy departed the centre in the evening prior to being processed. There have been a few reported sightings of Billy, however no one has had any contact with him since 1996. Billy Taylor's whereabouts remain unknown.

Jacket: Leather, Black, Canadian flag on back

Case reference: 2016057640.CaseDesc: In the early hours of October 10, 2016, Terence Alook was last seen when he left a party at his aunt's home in the community of Desmarais, Alberta. Mr. Alook had been visiting his friends and family in the north end of Desmarais.

Other: Chin, Two moles on the lower chin

Case reference: 2020010925.CaseDesc: On October 2, 1990, Mabel Wong was seen for the last time, at approximately 10:30pm, as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario. It is believed that Mabel left her home to go meet someone. Her vehicle was found approximately two kilometers from her home.

Shoes: Leather, Black, CASUAL, with metal tips

Case reference: 2014002315.CaseDesc: In 1983 Dennis Chubb moved to Winnipeg from God's Lake Narrows.  He was believed to be residing in a rooming house on Furby Street in the Downtown area of Winnipeg.  Dennis was last seen entering this rooming house after having been dropped off by a family member.  It is reported that Dennis moved from this rooming house and into another residence just prior to his disappearance. M. Chubb's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2018016267.CaseDesc: Yvette Bourgon was seen for the last time in Montreal on approximately January 1, 1965. Mrs. Bourgon was hospitalized at Louis-H Lafontaine, formerly known as St-Jean-de-Dieu. Mrs. Bourgon's footprints were found in the snow near the Lachine Canal in Verdun. Her purse was found without her wallet in close proximity to the footprints.

Case reference: 2016006283.CaseDesc: Larry LEGACY was reported missing on March 22, 1993 when friends and family had not heard from him in several weeks. He was last known to reside in Edmonton, Alberta, but also frequented the Round Hill area, southeast of Edmonton. He also frequently traveled to Calgary, Alberta and to British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014003568.CaseDesc: On August 7, 1998, Todd Russell Fraser was seen for the last time in the Fairview district in Vancouver, British Columbia. All his belongings were found in his apartment. Todd has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004567.CaseDesc: Marten Wenzel was last heard from by his family in August of 2004. Marten was known to contact his family at least once a month. During the time of his disappearance, Marten was living in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014002462.CaseDesc: Michel Blanchette resided in north-Montreal and was seen for the last time on October 6, 1972. Late that evening, he went to "Taverne Duvernay" located on "Boulevard de la Concorde" in Laval where he went missing and was never seen again.

Case reference: 2006002199.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1994, this Caucasian male, was found in a field on the south side of the Rogers Centre (formerly known as the SkyDome) at the far end of Rees Street in Toronto. His post-mortem length was approximately 6’2" and he weighed 162lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Missing several teeth; had a great deal of restorative work done in the past with multiple silver-amalgam restorations

Case reference: 2014006380.CaseDesc: Dean Kelly Morrison was last seen October 23, 2013, after being dismissed from his job. His vehicle was left abandoned on a ranch.

Case reference: 2015019929.CaseDesc: On April 16, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Sribavan Kandasamy was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2010003099.CaseDesc: On July 23, 2010, OPP received a report that support cheques for Shelley Anderson of Cobalt Ontario, were returned uncashed for the past 12 months. Police attempted to locate her but were unsuccessful. She was last seen in the Haileybury and Cobalt area some time during the summer of 2009. Ms. Anderson also has ties to the Timmins and Schumacher areas, as she lived there for most of her life.

Case reference: 2013000003.CaseDesc: On September 4, 2011, James "Jamie" Lee was camping with several friends at the Smoky Flats Campground. Jamie was last seen by friends during the early morning hours when he went for a walk by himself.

Case reference: 2014005435.CaseDesc: Although it is unconfirmed, acquaintances of Douglas Scott Renz indicate that he may have left the Chilliwack area in early 2009.  Mr. Renz last had contact with friends in the Chilliwack area in February of 2010, they reported him missing that April.

Case reference: 2014001558.CaseDesc: Mr. Cochrane was reported missing when his family expressed concern over his absence, as he had a history of memory loss and in the past ran into the bush and/or wandered off. An intensive land search was met with negative results. A set of footprints was found leading into the water of the river and an intensive operation involving drilling 10 holes through the ice in the area failed to turn up any evidence. The whereabouts of Mr. Cochrane remains unknown.

Teeth: 2 molars absent on upper right side
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Arm, Left arm in cast

Case reference: 2013000038.CaseDesc: Samuel Lachance was last seen at the Beverage Room in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan near the end of July, 1987. Samuel was in very good physical condition at the time of his disappearance and worked in different logging camps in Saskatchewan. Family members say that it was unusual for Samuel not to have any contact with them or his friends near the time he was last seen.

Case reference: 2015066998.CaseDesc:
Yvon Shawn Guignard moved to the northern part of Manitoba during the summer of 2015 in search of employment, with interests in Churchill and the Northwest Territories. While in Thompson, he adopted a transient lifestyle, living in his personal vehicle and developing friendships with the homeless community. 
It’s believed Mr. Guignard was last seen on November 28, 2015 at approximately 6:45am. Just prior to his disappearance, he made a number of attempts to give away his personal vehicle, which was located at the time he was reported missing. According to his family, he is schizophrenic, with a medical condition and he also has a history of not taking his prescription medications. He has been known to travel to undisclosed locations within the country and act secretive with family as to his whereabouts. He should not be approached as he may be in medical distress.

Case reference: 2016013490.CaseDesc: On March 15, 2016, Ravishankar Vallepuram was seen for the last time at his residence in Scarborough, Ontario. Ravishankar has never gone missing in the past, nor has he spent the night away from his residence.

Case reference: 2014005302.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2005, in Toronto, Canada, Zaina Trujillo-Talib was abducted by her father, Chaudhry Talib and her paternal grandmother, Shama Talib.  Chaudhry and Shama immediately took six-year-old Zaina to their family home located in Lahore, Pakistan.  Since this time, Zaina's mother has not been allowed to have any contact with her daughter.

Case reference: 2013000022.CaseDesc: Mr. Shenchiu "Andy" Tsou was last seen at the Halifax Casino on June 26, 2005. He was known as a regular client at the Casino. Mr. Tsou was travelling from Richmond BC.

Case reference: 2014003872.CaseDesc: Diane Bélanger was last seen on August 8, 1982, in the Ville-Marie borough of Montreal, Quebec. Diane hasn’t been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006020299.CaseDesc: Mary Ann Copeman was last seen on September 5, 1993 when she left to go on a recreational walk. Ms. Copeman was known to have mental health issues and may have been in a confused state. She was walking in the vicinity of Fifth Street in Balmertown, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005122.CaseDesc: Phillip Morin was last seen in the Colony Street area. Mr. Morin's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2019012891.CaseDesc: Dean Brett Todd was last seen by his brother, around Easter time in 2000, near First Memorial Services Kamloops (formerly Schoening Funeral Home) on Tranquille Road in Kamloops, British Columbia. Dean had been invited to dinner, but did not show up. Dean is known to travel between Kamloops and Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2016041786.CaseDesc: LeRoi La France was reported missing on March 31, 2016 when LeRoi’s siblings learned that a formal missing person report had never been made regarding their brother. He was last seen in October or November of 1964. In 1964 LeRoi was a student at UBC who lived in Burnaby BC and insured a 1952 VW Beetle.

Case reference: 2014004947.CaseDesc: On June 1, 2007, Ralph Hopper was seen for the last time as he was leaving the l'Aboiteau residence, a special care home where he lived in Dieppe, New Brunswick. Ralph is mentally challenged, diabetic and requires prescription medication.

Case reference: 2014003132.CaseDesc: On December 29, 1978, Sharon Drover was seen for the last time. Ms. Drover left her boarding house located in downtown St. John's, Newfoundland and arrived for her evening shift at McDonald’s restaurant. She finished her shift after midnight.

Case reference: 2014005532.CaseDesc: On September 20, 1984, Emily Koble had been picked up by two ladies that felt Mrs. Koble had appeared lost and confused. Mrs. Koble was dropped off near Christopher Lake, SK when she asked to get out of the vehicle. The ladies called the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, however, a search failed to locate Mrs. Koble.

Deformity: Shoulders, steel pin, unknown which shoulder

Case reference: 2014005735.CaseDesc: On December 24, 1998, Rostyslav Korolko was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance, Rostyslav was living with his brother and he had told him that he was going to look for work.

Case reference: 2014004252.CaseDesc: Gordie Dixon was reported missing by family members.  Mr. Dixon may have been seen on the Macleod Trail in Calgary, Alberta a couple of months before he was reported missing.

Case reference: 2013000054.CaseDesc: On December 28, 2006, Carlisle Callum-Drummond was seen for the last time in the Cotes-des-Neiges -Notre-Dame-de-Grace district of Montreal, Quebec. Carlisle left from his home and it is possible that he may be with his father, who is also missing.

Case reference: 2013000055.CaseDesc: Ronald Donelle has been missing since November 16, 2001. He was last seen dropping off his ex-wife in front of her home located in the Pierrefonds-Roxboro district in Montreal, Quebec. His vehicle has not been located.

Case reference: 2020006647.CaseDesc: On June 27, 1980, Ophlin Facey was seen for the last time as she left the residence of her employer. During the time of her disappearance, Ophlin was a live-in house keeper, and it is possible she may have been heading to a party that day.

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2013000141.CaseDesc: Brandyn Dirienzo was last seen on the evening of October 4, 2006, entering an apartment building in Chilliwack, B.C. Brandyn was living a high risk lifestyle and foul play is heavily suspected. The police investigation into the disappearance of Brandyn is focussed on identifying those who have directly caused Brandyn's disappearance and/or death.  Investigators are looking for any information from anyone who has knowledge on the whereabouts of Brandyn. Brandyn is the father of two young children and his family is deeply affected by his disappearance.

Teeth: Crooked, Current photos seem to indicate a possible broken, upper right, front tooth
Jacket: Cotton, Black, Hooded Sweatshirt with "G-Unit" logo

Case reference: 2014005105.CaseDesc: On May 11, 2001, at approximately 8:00 p.m., Younes Taleb was seen for the last time at his mother’s business in Toronto, Ontario.

Mark: Cheek, Mole on the right cheek

Case reference: 2008023299.CaseDesc: In the early morning hours of June 30, 2001, Istefan Toma returned home after work. He showered, changed his clothes and was observed leaving the family home at approximately 1 a.m. in his own vehicle. It was later discovered he had taken his identification and citizenship card, but did not take any clothing or other belongings with him. His vehicle was recovered from a parking lot in the vicinity of his work place at Woodbridge Mall (Hwy 7/Martingrove, Woodbridge, Ontario) on the 11th of February 2002, having been parked there for approximately 6-9 months. Mr. Toma has not been in contact with any family members nor his employers since he left his home on the morning of June 30, 2001. Mr. Toma speaks broken English, is known to smoke DuMaurier cigarettes and has been known to attend casinos on occasion. Mr. Toma's family and the police are concerned for his safety and well-being.

Mark: Nose, Mole on the right side of the nose

Case reference: 2018063238.CaseDesc: On January 20, 2001, Edward Pinarreto was seen for the last time when he left Toronto, Ontario, for a two-week vacation in Cuba. Edward was scheduled to return to Toronto on February 3, but never board his flight.

Case reference: 2014005052.CaseDesc: On March 28, 2007, Ohanes Melkon was last seen when he departed his residence located in Innisfail, Alberta to go purchase food.

Case reference: 2021014303.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2013, at approximately 3:56 p.m., Peter Lipinoga was last seen in the area of Terrapin Point in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of his disappearance, Peter was despondent.

Case reference: 2012020048.CaseDesc: Kathleen Johnston went missing from downtown Saskatoon, SK at approximately 2:15 p.m. on October 20, 1953. Miss Johnston got off of a city transit bus on her way to work at the Gem Café in the downtown area after visiting her mother at her residence.

Case reference: 2014004918.CaseDesc: On September 15th, 1993, three men were en route to Wuskwatim Lake via the Burntwood River intending to engage in commercial fishing. The men departed Nelson House, according to the only survivor they hit a rock and the motor quit. The boat was not equipped with a starter and the men were unable to restart the boat prior to going through the rapids.   Despite an intensive land, water and air search the bodies of Mr. Moose and Mr. Spence were never recovered.

Case reference: 2014003688.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1981, William Earnshaw was hunting in the Clemenceau District, SK, southwest of Hudson Bay, SK. He had separated from two companions and failed to meet at their vehicle in the evening. An extensive search of the area has failed to locate Mr. Earnshaw.

Case reference: 2014004972.CaseDesc: Asim Chaudhry was last seen leaving his residence on July 20, 2007 at 1400hrs to study for an upcoming exam at Simon Fraser University. Asim was despondent in the past.

Hair: Black, Brush Cut, Has a beard
Sweater: Cotton, Grey, Hooded with "Russel Athletic" in red and blue writing
Pants: Cotton, Grey, Sweat Pant, Sweat pants

Case reference: 2011002299.CaseDesc: On March 24, 1991, four-year-old Michael Dunahee went missing from an area of the playground at Blanshard Elementary School in Victoria, British Columbia.  At the time of his disappearance, Michael was at the playground with his mother, father, and younger sister.

Shoes: Canvas, Blue, Sneakers with red and orange trim
Jacket: Cloth, Blue, Hooded with red lining and red cuffs

Case reference: 2013000029.CaseDesc: On November 4, 1991, Montreal Police received a complaint from Mr. Katnick reporting that his daughter Leslie Anne Katnick was missing. Leslie Katnick had been residing in Montreal, Quebec until November 1, 1991, which was the last time she was seen by either friends or family. The investigation revealed that a Leslie Katnick registered into the Halifax YMCA on November 2, 1991, for several nights and returned the key on November 4, 1991. No further information has surfaced with respect to the whereabouts of Leslie Katnick. The circumstances of her disappearance are suspicious and foul play may be involved.

Case reference: 2014003913.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1973, Martin MAIER, 63 years old, was last seen leaving the Prelate, SK hotel at 1:00 a.m. Mr. MAIER was driving a 1971 Chevrolet half-ton, red with white half camper box, SK license F133013.  Extensive searches have been conducted, however neither Mr. MAIER or his vehicle have been located.

Sweater: Wool, Other, Siwash with a fish design

Case reference: 2013000132.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2008 Trevor Warkentin left the Pyschiatric Ward at the MSA Hospital in Abbotsford BC. A hospital staff worker believes seeing Trevor get into a red pick up truck, but no license plate was obtained.

Teeth: Good, Large gap between front teeth

Case reference: 2014002363.CaseDesc: On January 7, 1997, Darcy Puddicomb was seen for the last time. He departed his residence that morning with the intention of attending work. He did not arrive.

Case reference: 2014001731.CaseDesc: On August 5, 1987, Russell Atkinson was last seen boarding a Greyhound bus in Penticton, British Columbia. The bus was destined for Winnipeg, Manitoba.  Russell did not arrive in Winnipeg but his luggage was found on the bus.

Case reference: 2016060096.CaseDesc: Conrad Roderick Jason Ducharme was reported missing on October 25, 2016, by family members who had not heard from or seen him in two months. Conrad was last known by family to be hitch hiking to a meeting in Dixonville, Alberta in July 2016. He was last seen in Manning, Alberta, in early September 2016.

Case reference: 2006018499.CaseDesc: Tony Gikoff was last seen July 9, 1955, near Colborne, Ontario, at a property he rented to tenants. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003770.CaseDesc: Herbert Gross was to meet his girlfriend for lunch on May 4, 1996. He failed to show up, which was extremely out of character for him. On May 7th, a man described as being Caucasian, in his mid-20s, 5'7 and 140-150 lbs, clean shaven with short, brown hair, was seen moving items from Mr. Gross's suite. This man was wearing a dark shirt, faded jeans and white runners. Police feel Mr. Gross may have been the victim of foul play.

Case reference: 2014003406.CaseDesc: Anthony Janvier was last seen at the courthouse in Cold Lake, Alberta on April 8, 1998. He was reported missing by his mother on February 7, 2002. Anthony lived a transient lifestyle which accounts for the 4 year delay in reporting him missing.

Case reference: 2014004805.CaseDesc: Patrick Ratto was reported missing from his Burnaby residence July 27, 2006. There have been no confirmed sightings of Mr. Ratto since his disappearance. Mr. Ratto previously resided in Quebec and may have moved back. The Burnaby RCMP would like to speak with anyone who has any information on Mr. Ratto's whereabouts.

Hair: Brown, Short, Small brown & grey goatee
Jacket: Black, White, Windbreaker with white markings and a logo

Case reference: 2021047780.CaseDesc: Vincent McLean was last seen on October 1, 2021, at a rural property where he resided in Two Hills County, Alberta. There has been no activity from him since that date.

Case reference: 2014005582.CaseDesc: Lionel Joseph Daigle went missing from the New Direction Special Care home, located on the Westside of the City of Saint John. Mr. Daigle was last seen April 3, 2011. He is reported to have mental health issues and requires regular medication. The public is urged to contact the Saint John Police Force with any information concerning his whereabouts.

Jacket: Grey, Winter jacket, 3/4 length with hood

Case reference: 2014005409.CaseDesc: Rene Bruneau was last seen at Saskatchewan Hospital in North Battleford on June 27, 1965. Mr. Bruneau was noticed missing the next morning. He is from Leoville, Saskatchewan. His immediate family have not heard from or seen Mr. Bruneau.

Scar: Head, Surgical scar on forehead, ear to ear, from removal of tumour

Case reference: 2019081392.CaseDesc: Casey Badger was last seen leaving his home in Edmonton, Alberta, on January 28, 2020. He was travelling on foot and wrapped in a blanket.

Tattoo: Left Chest, Psalms 23 on left chest
Left Cheek, Cross on left cheek
Scar: Right Forearm, Multiple scars on right forearm

Case reference: 2014003365.CaseDesc: At approximately 2:00 p.m. on October 30, 1982, Daniel Christensen left the family cabin in the area of Long Lake, Manitoba. He left with the family dog and his intention was to go chicken hunting. His family reported him missing the next day.  On November 6, 1982, the family dog returned to the cabin in good health. Mr. Christensen has never been located.

Case reference: 2014001747.CaseDesc: On July 1, 1978, Brenda Bidner was seen for the last time in the Saint-Laurent District in Montreal, Quebec. She was known to travel frequently between Montreal and New York, in the United States. Brenda has not been seen and her family has not heard from her since.

Case reference: 2014002404.CaseDesc: On June 11, 1988, Andrew Flett was walking with others to the cutline. Mr. Flett  did not show up at the site and crew members thought he had returned to camp. Mr. Flett  was reported missing three days later to RCMP, and an extensive search was conducted. Mr. Flett  has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Shirt: Red, Black, plaid and button up

Case reference: 2014004464.CaseDesc: Singh Sukmwinder Lebahna was last seen in Montreal on February 26, 2004. He left the apartment he was sharing with a friend, taking all his personal belongings, stating he wanted to live in Vancouver. Singh is originally from India.

Case reference: 2021000929.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2020, Ronald O'Kell was reported missing to the New York State Police in Niagara Falls, New York. Ronald’s unoccupied vehicle was recovered from a parking lot on Goat Island, New York. It is suspected that he may have jumped into the falls.

Case reference: 2014005066.CaseDesc: James Douglas Turnball or Turnbull was last seen on the MV Princess of Vancouver vessel commuting from Nanaimo to Vancouver in the waters of the Howe Sound in 1966. Bowen Island RCMP are seeking any next of kin or close relations for the missing male.

Jewelry: Gold, Yellow, Black, black diamond ring
Gold, Yellow, Brown, Timex watch with leather strap

Case reference: 2006005899.CaseDesc:
On August 19, 1994, the body of a Caucasian male was found in the Niagara River. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 134 lbs and his length was measured between 5’8"-5’9",  however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
His appendix was present. He is believed to have been in the water several days to weeks.

Teeth: Teeth were natural, a few restorations on his lower right posterior teeth.
Scar: Front surface of his left wrist, 1cm in length
Inner surface of his right wrist, 1cm in length
Two scars on his left forehead, 1cm-2cm in length

Case reference: 2021042160.CaseDesc: On September 16, 2021, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Darren Werner was last seen at his residence in the town Niagara-on-the-Lake in Ontario. It is possible that Darren had gotten into an unknown vehicle.

Case reference: 2019016353.CaseDesc: On March 13th 2019 Michael Steele was seen for the last time at the Cape Breton Regional Hospital Emergency Department.

Case reference: 2014004744.CaseDesc: Cyril Detimmerman and a friend left Brandon, Manitoba on the Assiniboine River traveling to Treherne. Cyril was experienced at navigating along this river route, however water conditions at that time had been very high as a result of the spring flooding. The pair soon encountered strong currents and large amounts of debris on the river. In the process of trying to navigate to shore the boat capsized causing both men to enter the water. Both men were wearing life jackets. Extensive searches conducted by land, air, water and dragging operations several miles along the river all with negative results. Mr. Detimmerman was never found and is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2022001276.CaseDesc: On December 31, 2021, Emily Bailey was seen for the last time in Hamilton, Ontario. Emily is known to live a transient lifestyle, but is also known to remain in constant contact with her friends and family via social media. All of her social media activity has stopped since December 27, 2021.

Backpack: Light Blue, Black, Has black handles

Case reference: 2008004699.CaseDesc: Adave Francis was last seen October 12, 1999, at 6:00 p.m. riding his bicycle on the farm property located at Poplar side road in the Collingwood area. Mr. Francis was a seasonal worker from Jamaica.

Case reference: 2013000042.CaseDesc: On August 8, 1999, Mary Smith was seen for the last time as she checked herself out of the Selkirk Mental Health Centre in Selkirk, Manitoba. Prior to her disappearance, Mary had received medical treatment, for head injuries, at the Health Sciences Center in Winnipeg. It is out of character for Mary, a mother of four, to not contact her family.

Tattoo: Right Hand, Flower- orchid or poinsettia

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2014001067.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1993, the body of an unidentified elderly woman was found in the Fraser River, upstream from the city of New Westminster, British-Columbia. She wore a single octagonal silver ring on her left hand and had full dentures.

Ring: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Third finger on left hand, octagonal shape

Case reference: 2008019999.CaseDesc: Patrick O’Connell has been missing since July 4, 2008. He was last seen by a friend and roommate. Patrick suffers from schizophrenia, substance abuse issues, and has previously made comments that he may harm himself.

Case reference: 2016046700.CaseDesc: Mr. LADD was last seen on August 18, 2016, by his daughter at his residence where he prepared them dinner.  Mr. LADD stated he needed to run out for a while and did not return.

Case reference: 2021018406.CaseDesc: On April 27, 2021, an unidentified man was discovered in a tent in a wooded area south of the fire station located on 95 Sandalwood Parkway East in Brampton, Ontario. He was found with two pairs of reading glasses and a lighter.

Underwear: Boxer briefs; size: medium: black waistband; brand: YellowTag
Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Wrist, Poorly healed fracture of right wrist
